forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.shortForecast: Mostly Cloudy then Areas Of Fog
forecast.detailedForecast: Areas of fog after midnight. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 56. West southwest wind 10 to 17 mph, with gusts as high as 22 mph.

forecast.name: Sunday
forecast.shortForecast: Areas Of Fog then Mostly Sunny
forecast.detailedForecast: Areas of fog before 9am. Mostly sunny. High near 70, with temperatures falling to around 67 in the afternoon. West southwest wind 9 to 21 mph, with gusts as high as 26 mph.

weather_report:
Even in the early hours, a delicate veil of fog hangs over Downtown San Francisco, with the soft embrace of clouds melding into the cool night air. Despite the faint chill, the temperature holds a mild promise of warmth, beckoning the dawn with whispers of clarity. The winds, playful yet persistent, carry with them a refreshing whisper as they dance through the streets.

As the sun rises, lifting the fog ever so slightly, Sunday reveals itself as a canvas splashed with bright hues of blue. By mid-morning, visibility will improve, providing glimpses of well-known landmarks kissed by sunlight, though traces of the morning mist will linger just enough to remind us of the ocean's embrace. The predicted temperatures will encourage thoughts of light layers, perhaps a comfortable shirt accompanied by a light jacket to chase away the remaining chill. For those who stroll the waterfront or wander through the parks, it is an excellent day to let the breezes caress your skin while sipping hot coffee or engaging in leisurely conversations with friends. The day invites ordinary activities infused with a touch of beauty, perfect for discovering new favorite nooks amidst the familiar.
